introduce task: This is the short story about the childhood and life of a young woman. Let's see how quickly you can read it aloud today while using your magnifier. There are three pages for you to read; you will be timed. As soon as you are done reading, please tap the screen to let me know you are finished. When you have your magnifier and are ready to start reading, please tap my screen to let me know you're going to begin.

Please read these short sentences with your magnifier as quickly as you can without making mistakes, starting with the largest ones and keep going until you get to the smallest one that you can read with your magnifier. They get so small that they become impossible for anyone to read, so don't expect to read all of the sentences. Do your best to read quickly and accurately with your magnifier today!

Please read these words and letters with your magnifier as quickly as you can without making mistakes, starting with the largest ones and keep going until you get to the smallest one that you can read with your magnifier. These are not sentences, but rather just random single words and letters. Try not to skip or miss any words or letters. Give it your best shot!

This is a short paragraph of text that is similar to newspaper sized print. Please use your magnifier to read it aloud as quickly as possible without going back and making corrections. I will time you. Also, you should try not to miss or misread any of the words since that will impact your score. Let's see how fast and accurately you can read with your magnifier today!

This reading task involves spot reading the numbers on common household items. Please read the numbers aloud to me and then also enter them on the tablet. For each item, I will ask you to find and read something specific that is of interest to me on the item while using your magnifier. Do your best to read the numbers on the items accurately.

IReST: This reading task involves reading a single paragraph aloud while using your magnifier. I would like to see how quickly and accurately you can read today. I'm curious to know what is written there today.
MNread: This reading task involves reading single sentences, going from large print to very tiny, fine print. You can start without your magnifier for the larger sentences and then remember to use your magnifier when the sentences become more difficult to read as they get smaller. They get so small that no human can read them, so don't get discouraged when you can't read all of them. Try to read them as quickly as possible, without making mistakes. SKread: This reading task involves using your magnifier to read aloud a series of single words that are grouped according to size from large to tiny.
